H0.text: Solid to gas are the states of matter involved when nitrogen boils at -196 °C.

H1.text: Liquid to gas is the states of matter involved when nitrogen boils at –196 °C.

H2.text: Liquid to solid are the states of matter involved when nitrogen boils at its boiling point of –196 °C.

H3.text: Gas to liquid is the states of matter involved when nitrogen boils at its boiling point of –196 °C.

A4.text: Liquid nitrogen has a boiling point of about −196 °C.

A5.text: Liquid nitrogen (LN2) is nitrogen in a liquid state at low temperature.
